name: Kepler-4
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-4 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-4 is a star with 1.22 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.49 times its radius. It is located 1793.858 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-4 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-4 system

Kepler-4 b

Kepler-4 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the Transit method. The mass of Kepler-4 b is 24.472 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-4 b is 4.002 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-4 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-4, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
